abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for
            Namibia's Integrated Community-Based Ecosystem
            Management Project, which supports ecosystem processes to
            conserve biodiversity, identifies negative environmental
            impacts and proposes the following as mitigation measures.
            To prevent further marginalization of women, include women
            in awareness training, capacity, building, and conservancy
            processes. Develop viable income generating and livelihood
            diversifying options among target groups. Draw up tourism
            option plans and provide tourism awareness and training to
            reduce nuisance to communities. Implement equitable
            distribution of benefits due to tourism and support service
            organization participation in facilitating discussions to
            avoid internal community conflict. To encourage community
            empowerment and power-sharing arrangements with the private
            sector, provide training and facilitation to conservancies.
            To control biophysical impacts resulting from tourism, like
            the increased use of natural resources, groundwater and
            river contamination, more of-road driving, and interference
            with wildlife, develop land-use zoning and development
            guidelines, monitor environmental compliance, strengthen
            staff skills, and pass laws enforcing policy. To prevent
            causing harmful impacts because of profit maximization,
            promote a sustainable development approach. Carry out a
            training needs assessment for each individual conservancy.
            Develop a water management/water use plan. When
            translocating game, enable livestock owners to access
            alternative grazing areas and reintroduce predators only if
            the benefits outweigh the costs. Limit reintroducing species
            to those who have historically occurred in the area.
